thread.title: Slate Is taking Steps to Reduce Its Page Load Time by 75 Percent
thread.title_full: Slate Is taking Steps to Reduce Its Page Load Time by 75 Percent

title: Slate Is taking Steps to Reduce Its Page Load Time by 75 Percent
text:
Print Page by: Joseph Lichterman | NiemanLab 
About two months ago, Slate began an ambitious project: It wanted to reduce the load time of its website by 75 percent by the end of the year. 

On average, it took about 16 seconds for Slateâ€™s entire site to load (though much of that occurred after the page was already visible to users). Slate wanted to reduce the time to about four seconds, Dan Check, vice chairman of the Slate Group, told me.
